Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic missed a game-tying 3-pointer at the buzzer.
The Nuggets mounted a fourth-quarter comeback to wipe out Minnesota’s 16-point lead and establish a 10-point advantage.
The Timberwolves closed out the game with a 10-0 run, ultimately winning 119-116.
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams have undergone changes since their Western Conference Semifinals matchup, particularly the Timberwolves, who traded Karl-Anthony Towns and brought in Julius Randle and Donte DiVincenzo.
Post-Match Reflections: Nuggets forward Michael Porter Jr. acknowledged the possibility that the team could be broken up if they continue to struggle this year.
